About the Role: As a Data Analyst at Sunway Healthcare Group, you will play a vital role in transforming raw data into actionable insights to support decision-making and improve business outcomes. You will utilize advanced analytics techniques and tools to discover patterns, trends, and insights while ensuring data quality and effective visualization. Key Responsibilities: Data Preparation and Analysis: Aggregate, clean, and prepare data for analysis using best practices in data preparation. Collaborate with data engineers to define and enhance data pipelines. Perform statistical modeling and develop analytics models to support business initiatives. Insight Generation and Decision Support: Identify trends and patterns to address business questions and challenges. Consult with stakeholders to investigate issues using data-driven approaches, even without predefined hypotheses. Develop actionable insights that improve decision-making processes. Visualization and Communication: Create compelling visualizations and presentations to convey insights clearly to stakeholders. Use data visualization tools like Power BI to simplify complex data narratives. Tools and Technology Expertise: Work with business intelligence applications such as Power BI. Leverage Power BI Dataflows for centralized and reusable ETL processes and integration with datasets. Use data querying and processing tools, including SQL, or Python, to extract and analyze data. Familiarity with cloud and big data technologies (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) to enable efficient data management and integration with Power BI. Skills and Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Analytics, Computer Science, or a related field. Relevant certifications in data analytics or business intelligence like Power BI. Strong background in data analysis and querying languages such as SQL and Python. Proficiency in using analytics and visualization tools like Power BI to extract, analyze, and present insights. Proficiency in creating and managing Power BI Dataflows to standardize and automate data transformation processes. Familiarity with data preparation, cleansing, and transformation techniques for effective analysis. Ability to identify trends, patterns, and correlations in complex datasets to inform decisions. Experience in working with cloud-based analytics environments and tools, including the use of dataflows for integration and scalability. Knowledge in statistical modeling and data interpretation to derive actionable insights. Effective communication skills with both technical and non-technical teams. Strong collaboration abilities, working effectively in a team setting. Skilled in identifying and solving data-related challenges in cloud environments. Adept at staying ahead of the curve in cloud data technologies and practices. If you are interested in driving impactful analytics in a healthcare setting and contributing to the organization’s success, we welcome your application.

Get To Know Our Team: The Consumer Experience Tech Family is a group of passionate Product Managers, Designers, Analytics and Engineers dedicated to delivering exceptional experiences to our users. We thrive on collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning. As a member of the Data Scientist (Analytics) team, you'll have the opportunity to work alongside talented professionals from diverse backgrounds and contribute to projects that are shaping the future of how customers engage and interact with our platform in Southeast Asia. Get To Know The Role Product Experimentation and A/B Testing: Collaborate closely with product managers to define hypotheses and design experiments aimed at improving the consumer experience. Run A/B testing frameworks, quasi-experiments and statistical methodologies to measure the impact of product changes on key metrics such as user engagement, retention, and conversion rates. Analyze experiment results to draw actionable insights and make data-driven recommendations for product iterations and enhancements. Advance Analytics, Root Cause Analysis and Insights Generation: Conduct in-depth analysis of user behavior data to uncover actionable insights and opportunities for product improvements. Utilize advanced statistical techniques and machine learning algorithms to identify patterns, trends, and correlations in large datasets. Work closely with cross-functional teams to translate insights into actionable recommendations for product enhancements and optimizations. Collaboration with Product Managers: Work hand-in-hand with product managers to understand user needs, pain points, and business objectives. Provide analytical support and guidance to product teams throughout the product development lifecycle, from ideation to implementation. Act as a strategic partner to product managers, helping them make informed decisions and prioritize features based on data-driven insights. Developing Product and Feature Performance Tracking Dashboards: Design and develop dashboards to track the performance of products and features, providing stakeholders with real-time visibility into key metrics and KPIs. Implement data visualization best practices to ensure that dashboards are intuitive, informative, and actionable for product organizations. Empower product managers and stakeholders to monitor the impact of product changes and make data-driven decisions to drive continuous improvement. Highlight trends, anomalies, and areas for optimization through visually compelling dashboards, enabling proactive decision-making and rapid response to emerging issues. Qualifications Bachelors or Masters degree in Statistics, Analytics, Economics, Mathematics, Engineering, or other quantitative subjects 3+ years experience in Analytics, Business Intelligence or Data Science role, preferably in an Internet company with large, complex, high-velocity data Advanced SQL writing skills and experience in querying large relational databases Ability to distill data and articulate an actionable point of view to non-technical audiences and senior stakeholders using presentations, interactive visualizations, et al. Ability to handle multiple priorities and solve ambiguous problems in a fast-paced environment Hands-on experience with data analysis/programming tools like R or Python and Data Visualization platforms like Tableau / PowerBI / D3.js, etc Experience with designing, running, and analyzing A/B tests and product experiments. Should also have an understanding of hypothesis testing and the basic principles of DoE

Key Responsibilities: Define and drive the technical direction for AI/ML/Generative AI initiatives, aligning solutions with client business goals and digital transformation strategies. Translate complex business objectives into actionable technical strategies, while proactively identifying potential risks or misaligned initiatives in client engagements. Design robust AI engineering frameworks to support the deployment, evaluation, and management of AI/ML models and Generative AI solutions for client projects. Evaluate and recommend the best technologies for clients, ensuring scalability, interoperability, and alignment with industry best practices. Contribute to the development of MLOps and LLMOps practices, focusing on operational efficiency for client organizations. Engage with client stakeholders, including business leaders, data scientists, engineers, and architects, to refine AI solutions and ensure alignment with their business objectives. Collaborate on use case development and solution optimization, fostering strong partnerships and ensuring that technical strategies address current and future business needs. Lead the development of AI prototypes that demonstrate the potential and feasibility of AI/ML solutions for client use cases. Design and implement rapid prototypes to test and validate AI models, ensuring alignment with client needs and business objectives. Iterate and refine prototypes based on client feedback and technical evaluations to accelerate solution adoption. Conduct in-depth market research to assess client industry trends and AI needs, while performing comparative analyses of the company’s AI products versus competitor offerings. Identify unique selling points and craft compelling competitive advantages for client proposals, helping to position the company’s AI solutions as the best fit for client objectives and market opportunities. Collaborate with AI product managers and client business stakeholders to develop a deep understanding of market dynamics and customer demands. Provide strategic insights into the strengths and weaknesses of the company’s AI products, helping shape AI product roadmaps and client proposals to deliver differentiated value. Stay on top of emerging AI/ML technologies and methodologies, conducting research to evaluate their applicability to client-specific challenges. Provide data-driven insights to help clients make informed decisions on technology trade-offs and prioritize AI innovations that drive long-term business value. Job Requirements: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, or related field. Experience in a leadership role in AI/ML domain capacity. Track record of successful collaboration with cross-functional teams and stakeholders. Extensive hands-on experience in driving the development of AI solutions from concept to execution. This includes designing, building, and iterating on AI/ML models and deploying them in real-world, high-stakes environments, utilizing cloud native services. Ability to travel as needed based on project requirements. Experience in providing strategic consultancy to organizations on the adoption and integration of advanced AI and Cloud solutions. Skilled in guiding clients through the entire lifecycle of AI projects—from ideation and proof-of-concept to full-scale deployment. Experience in data engineering and building scalable data pipelines to support AI/ML workflows. Proficiency in data ingestion, ETL processes, data cleaning, and transformation using tools like Apache Kafka, Apache Spark, Airflow, and SQL/NoSQL databases. Proficiency in deploying and optimizing AI workloads on GPU-based infrastructures. Understanding of GPU hardware configurations and how to leverage GPU clusters for scalability and performance optimization. Deep knowledge of Generative AI/LLMs, with experience dabbling with pre-training, SFT, RLHF and productionizing agentic solutions.

Company Description About SEEK SEEK operates market-leading online employment marketplaces, including Jobstreet and Jobsdb in Asia. SEEK has been helping people live more fulfilling and productive working lives and helping organisations succeed for over 25 years. Founded and headquartered in Melbourne, Australia, SEEK has grown into a multinational technology company with over 3,300 employees and is listed on the Australian Securities Exchange. SEEK’s presence spans Australia, New Zealand, Hong Kong, Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore and Thailand. Additionally, SEEK has minority investments in employment marketplaces in China, South Korea and Bangladesh. SEEK develops and applies innovative data and technology tools to facilitate high-quality matching and improve reliability of marketplace information. In 2021, 2022, 2023 and 2024, SEEK was recognised as one of Australia’s Top Ten Places to Work in Technology in the AFR BOSS Best Places to Work awards. SEEK was also named a 5-Star Employer of Choice by HRD Asia in 2024 and won four accolades at TalentCorp’s Life at Work Awards 2023 in Malaysia. Job Description About the role SEEK is recruiting data analysts at all levels to partner with the Product Team. Seniority will be commensurate with prior experience. In this role, you will support decision-making, drive innovation, and help create exceptional products for our customers. Reporting to an Analytics Manager or Principal Data Analyst, you'll join a team of data analysts collaborating closely with Product Managers across SEEK. Success in this role involves delivering analytical solutions that provide insights into how well our products meet customer needs. This includes creating dashboards, conducting A/B tests, and performing in-depth analyses. We’re seeking a self-starter with strong problem-solving skills, the ability to navigate ambiguity, and comfort working in a fast-paced environment. You must demonstrate good judgment under pressure, a solid background in analytics, and knowledge of key concepts like A/B testing. Attention to detail, organizational excellence, and strong communication skills are crucial. The ideal candidate combines sharp business insight with a proven track record to understand partner needs and translate them into actionable insights. You’ll ensure Product Managers can confidently track product performance, assess the impact of developments, and effectively communicate metrics. Ultimately, your goal is to help our product function optimize outcomes for our customers. Responsibilities: Serve as a trusted analytics partner to collaborators in your specific product area, owning engagement and building positive relationships. Develop structured frameworks for measuring product health (e.g., conversion funnels). Identify and resolve issues, risks, and dependencies effectively. Collaborate with data and product teams to ensure data availability meets business objectives and requirements. Translate sophisticated requirements into actionable documentation. Qualifications Skills and Experience : Proficiency in analytics, mathematics, and statistics, with tertiary qualifications in a related field (e.g., Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science) advantageous. 1-5 years of experience working with large, sophisticated datasets, delivering intuitive insights, and translating business needs into data and tracking requirements. Strong SQL skills (Python proficiency and experience with Tableau or similar tools are a plus). Proven ability to work on projects with ambiguity and shifting priorities, collaborating with cross-functional teams, including data science, engineering, and product managers. Sophisticated problem-solving and analytical skills with a demonstrated ability to communicate insights effectively to collaborators. Strong emotional intelligence, encouraging trust and collaboration with a compassionate and inclusive communication style. Exceptional organizational, multitasking, and prioritization skills with attention to detail. Additional requirements for Senior Analysts: Advanced SQL expertise, including window functions, query optimization, and data modeling standard methodologies. Proficiency in experimental design and statistical methods, such as selecting appropriate statistical tests. Proven experience leading senior collaborators and navigating sophisticated relationships. Skilled in sophisticated visualization techniques such as building interactive dashboards with filters, parameterized fields, and drill-throughs for diverse audiences. Able to guide and mentor junior analysts on analytics standard methodologies. Additional Information The Team The AIPS team is structured into small, cross-disciplinary, autonomous teams of 4-10 people who research, design, develop and support ML data driven products to support the business needs of one or more of SEEK’s 18 global business units. Permanent position Hybrid working mode Mature & collaborative working culture Extensive employee benefits At SEEK, we are passionate about fostering a culture of inclusion and wellbeing that embraces and values the diversity of our people. We are a purpose driven business that works with heart. We know teams with diverse ideas, experiences and perspectives are more creative and are critical to ensuring effective delivery and innovating to enable our future success. As such, we welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and life experiences, especially as they relate to gender, sexual identity, culture, faith, disability and life stages. If you have the skills, curiosity and an adaptable mindset but don't meet every responsibility or qualification listed in this advertisement, please still get in touch with us. Should you require any specific support or adjustments throughout the recruitment process and beyond, please advise us and we will be happy to assist. SEEK kindly requests no unsolicited resumes or approaches from recruitment agencies and will not be responsible for any associated fees.

Position Summary This position involves the development and enhancement of Reconext internal IP testers for NAND, DRAM chips, SD cards. It also covers testers development in hardware/ firmware/ GUI, evaluation + Implementation of solutions to volume production, with the goal of achieving Continuous Improvement Objectives. This position requires effective collaboration with internal functional teams, and you will report directly to Engineering Manager. Duties and responsibilities of the job Develop Test Software Coding and processing of storage NAND, DRAM, SD card products knowledge will be an advantage. Test Software Coding for Test Process and Productivity improvement Projects. From Problem/Failure analysis/Debug to solution implementation. Firmware development and improvement. Experience in Xilinx or others FPGA development board. Familiar with NAND flash architecture, ONFI commands, Toggle commands, DDR3/DDR4/DDR5 architecture. Updating and maintain all Products specification into product data fact system. Work and liaise with internal customers on new NAND & DRAM PN, software evaluation and release. With at least 5 years of relevant working experience in above-related fields. Require having fluent English communication skills in both writing and verbal. Able to work independently. Must be a proactive and strong team player, able to engage with people, having a high sense responsibility and accountability. Able to work at our Innovation Lab located Prai, Penang.

Job Overview We are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented Analyst to join the Group Business Analytics team. This role is ideal for individuals with a passion for data science and analytics, who are eager to apply their technical skills to solve complex business challenges. As an Analyst, you will work collaboratively with senior team members to deliver actionable insights, develop predictive models, and support data-driven decision-making across the organization. Key Responsibilities • Analyze large datasets from multiple sources to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights. • Support machine learning projects by preparing data, performing feature engineering, and contributing to model development and evaluation. • Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., Marketing, Finance, Operations) to identify business problems and propose analytics-driven solutions. • Assist in developing and deploying predictive models for business forecasting, customer segmentation, and other use cases. • Build and maintain interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations to track key performance indicators (KPIs). • Ensure the accuracy and integrity of data by cleaning, validating, and preprocessing datasets. • Leverage Azure Cloud Services, such as Azure Machine Learning, Databricks, and Azure Data Factory, to manage, analyze, and model data. • Contribute to Generative AI initiatives, exploring its applications for business use cases such as content creation, personalization, and advanced problem-solving. • Conduct ad-hoc analyses and experiments (e.g., A/B testing) to support business objectives. • Stay updated with the latest tools and techniques in data science, analytics, cloud computing, and artificial intelligence. • Document methodologies, findings, and recommendations for technical and non-technical stakeholders. Key Attributes • Eagerness to learn and grow in the field of data science, analytics, and AI. • A detail-oriented mindset with a commitment to delivering high-quality work. • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically about complex problems. • Flexibility and adaptability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment. Qualifications • Bachelor’s degree in Data science, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field. • 1+ year of working experience in a data science or analytics role. • Hands-on experience with machine learning algorithms and frameworks such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch. • Strong proficiency in Python and familiarity with SQL. • Practical experience with Azure Cloud Services, including Azure Machine Learning, Databricks, and Azure Data Factory. • Analytical mindset with experience in working with large datasets and drawing meaningful insights. • Knowledge of data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau. • Familiarity with Generative AI technologies, such as transformer-based models (e.g., GPT, BERT) and their applications in solving business problems. • Basic understanding of statistical concepts and experience with data modeling. • Exposure to domains like natural language processing (NLP), time-series forecasting, or similar fields is a plus. • Strong communication and collaboration skills to work with both technical and business stakeholders.

Job Description: To plan and coordinate M&E works for project site. To carry out construction on specific areas of mechanical and electrical works. To coordinate & carry out regular Preventive Maintenance, servicing and testing on all electrical installation/ equipment. Responsible for the management & technical support of servers/routers/switches/ network in Data Centre environment. To carry out routine maintenance work and respond to equipment faults. To attend breakdown, troubleshooting, service and repair at site. To monitor the progress of M&E works ensure it is completed in accordance with the project requirements and budget, and that any issues or delays are identified and addressed promptly. To construct building facilities, electronic system, air conditioning system and plumbing system especially for Data Centre. To undertake any and all other duties and responsibilities as instructed by the superior Manage and supervise maintenance vendor for PPM and repairing work process Prepared for unexpected incident and immediate response for breakdown troubleshooting and alarm monitoring. Manage personnel entry to the Data Centre. Monitor, manage CCTV and door access Monitor the environment of the Data Centre (temperature, humidity, electrical, cooling) Monitor the safety of the Data Centre (power shortage, smoke and fire, water leak) Manage and coordinate vendor in performing maintenance Manage inventory and asset movement in the Data Centre (asset tagging, labelling, decommission) Manage and coordinate cabling in the Data Centre (tracing, labelling, management) Assist in the installation of Data Centre equipment (server, switches, storage) Ensuring no downtime for the Data Centre (power outage, network downtime, server downtime) To perform equipment status checks or Health check on equipment (servers, M&E, AC, safety equipment) Job Requirement: Degree in Mechanical/Electrical Engineering/ Computer Science. Minimum 2 years of working experience in Data Centre environment. Experience as M&E Engineer in Data Centre is a must Shift operation is required HOW TO APPLY: Interested applicants, kindly send your resume in MS WORD format or please click on “Apply Now”. Position Summary: The Simulation Engineer is responsible for designing, developing, and implementing simulation models using Python to support operational decision-making and optimization efforts. This role involves creating simulations to model real-world scenarios in areas such as warehouse logistics, manufacturing processes, or supply chain operations. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, build robust simulation frameworks, analyse model outputs, and provide actionable insights for process improvement. Key Responsibilities: 1. Simulation Model Development: Design and develop simulation models using Python to replicate real-world systems and processes, focusing on performance, accuracy, and scalability. Create dynamic models that account for various operational variables (e.g., capacity constraints, resource allocation, lead times). Implement libraries (e.g., SimPy, PySCeS, Pyomo) and frameworks suitable for discrete-event, agent-based, or continuous simulation. 2. Data Integration & Preprocessing: Collect and preprocess data from relevant sources (e.g., databases, APIs, CSV files) to ensure models are based on accurate and up-to-date information. Use Python libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy) for data cleaning, transformation, and analysis, preparing data for integration into simulation models. Validate and refine data inputs to improve model accuracy and ensure results align with real-world operations. 3. Model Testing & Validation: Conduct rigorous testing of simulation models to ensure accuracy, robustness, and reliability. Calibrate models based on historical data and conduct validation exercises to ensure the models’ predictive accuracy. 4. Scenario Analysis & Optimization: Run simulation experiments to analyze various scenarios, test hypotheses, and evaluate the impact of different strategies (e.g., inventory adjustments, scheduling changes). Optimize model parameters to improve key performance metrics such as processing times, resource utilization, and cost savings. Provide recommendations based on simulation outcomes, helping stakeholders make informed decisions. 5. Continuous Learning & Improvement: Keep current with trends and advancements in simulation techniques, Python libraries, and data science methodologies. Experiment with advanced modelling techniques (e.g., machine learning integration, Monte Carlo simulations) to further enhance simulation insights. Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, or a related field. 3+ years of experience in Python programming, with a strong focus on simulation development. Proficiency in Python simulation libraries (e.g., SimPy, PySCeS) and data manipulation tools (e.g., Pandas, NumPy). Solid understanding of simulation methodologies (discrete-event, agent-based, Monte Carlo) and optimization techniques. Experience with version control (e.g., Git) and code management practices. Preferred Skills: Experience with visualization libraries (e.g., Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly) for simulation result reporting. Knowledge of cloud computing or distributed computing for running large-scale simulations. Familiarity with database management (SQL) and data integration. Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work with complex systems and processes. Excellent communication skills for presenting technical findings to non-technical stakeholders.

Debug and resolve complex issues, and recommend improvements to ensure a well-functioning ETL pipelined architecture. Transform raw data into easy-to-use tables for the Data Analysts. Keep up-to-date on company products and new releases to efficiently plan changes in our data warehouse or pipelines. You may enjoy working with us if you: Have a good background in cybersecurity and data protection Proficiency in using data pipeline and workflow management tools such as Luigi Exposure to maintaining and monitoring database health and resolving errors Experience in managing stakeholders’ expectations and technical requirement gathering Familiarity with container technologies such as Docker A fintech background We would love to work with you if you: Have a minimum of 5 years of experience in the data engineering field Have expertise in data modelling techniques such as Kimball star schema, Anchor modelling, and Data vault Competence in object-oriented or object function scripting languages such as Python Proficiency in relational SQL and NoSQL databases, preferably with PostgreSQL, PITR, Pg_basebackup, WAL archival, and Replication Familiarity with column-oriented storage or data warehouses such as parquet, Redshift, and Bigquery In-depth skills in developing and maintaining ETL/ELT data pipelines and workflow management tools such as Airflow Hands-on experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) services such as BigQuery, scheduled queries, Cloud Storage and Cloud Functions Familiar with alerting and self-recovery methods concerning data accuracy Analytical skills with the ability to transform data into optimal business decisions Expertise in peer reviewing pipeline codes and suggesting improvements when required Experience in helping teams make informed business decisions with data Strong communication and presentation skills Fluency in spoken and written English Benefits: We pay competitive salaries based on your skills, qualifications, experience and market rates. Additionally, you’ll be eligible for an annual bonus based on individual and company performance. You’ll also receive comprehensive health benefits, including private medical insurance, life insurance, and health screenings. You’ll get generous annual and parental leave, and we’ll cover the costs of professional development and education related to advancing your career at Deriv. At our modern headquarters in Cyberjaya, you’ll join a diverse community of over 600 talented individuals. You’ll have the chance to significantly impact our company’s success while experiencing Malaysia’s perfect blend of cutting-edge technology and tropical surroundings. You can learn more about our Malaysia office. Our culture is unique, and we live by our values and leadership principles, so it’s worth learning more about Deriv’s culture. Imagine what you could do with us. If you’re ready to take on this exciting challenge and lead our customer service into the future, we can’t wait to hear from you. Deriv is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We take pride in our Great Place to Work and IIP Platinum certifications, which reflect our commitment to creating an exceptional work environment. Join us and help build the future of online trading while working alongside top talent from over 80 nationalities.

Job Title: (Fresh Grad ONLY - intake July 2025 onwards) Engineer, Quality Assurance
Job Responsibilities: Company Description At Western Digital, our vision is to power global innovation and push the boundaries of technology to make what you thought was once impossible, possible. At our core, Western Digital is a company of problem solvers. People achieve extraordinary things given the right technology. For decades, we’ve been doing just that—our technology helped people put a man on the moon and capture the first-ever picture of a black hole. We offer an expansive portfolio of technologies, HDDs, and platforms for business, creative professionals, and consumers alike under our Western Digital®, WD®, WD_BLACKTM, and SanDisk® Professional brands. We are a key partner to some of the largest and highest-growth organizations in the world. From enabling systems to make cities safer and more connected, to powering the data centers behind many of the world’s biggest companies and hyperscale cloud providers, to meeting the massive and ever-growing data storage needs of the AI era, Western Digital is fueling a brighter, smarter future. Today’s exceptional challenges require your unique skills. Together, we can build the future of data storage. Job Description Focal person in managing product quality since new product introduction throughout product life cycle. Participate in new product introductions to manufacturing by ensuring readiness of quality control systems and processes, verifying product quality monitoring and test capabilities, and addressing potential quality issues early to resolve them before production begins. Monitor product and process indicators to ensure compliance to quality requirement. Analyse indicators to identify trends, deviations, or opportunities for improvement. Utilize digital tools and platforms for real-time monitoring, reporting, and quality management. Working closely with respective issue owners to manage the non-conformity or inferior quality Finished Goods based on verification of data, risk assessment & engineering judgments. Coordinating quality improvement activities to address internal factory quality incidences & follow up with process team on root cause findings, corrective actions and the improvement plan. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify, analyze, and resolve quality issues including HDD feedback. Leverage data analytics tools to interpret quality metrics, generate insights, and propose actionable improvements. Assist in the development and maintenance of quality assurance procedures, documentation, and best practices. Other tasks and assignments in sustaining & improving process control & product quality. Qualifications REQUIRED Bachelor or Master Degree in Engineering, Data Science, Statistics or Science related field. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. PREFERRED SKILLS: Familiarity with quality assurance methodologies (e.g., ISO standards, Six Sigma, or similar frameworks) is an added advantage. Basic knowledge of data analytics tools (e.g., Excel, Power BI, Spotfire, Python, or similar software). Excellent communication and teamwork abilities. High attention to detail and a proactive mindset in identifying and addressing potential issues. Additional Information Western Digital thrives on the power and potential of diversity. As a global company, we believe the most effective way to embrace the diversity of our customers and communities is to mirror it from within. We believe the fusion of various perspectives results in the best outcomes for our employees, our company, our customers, and the world around us. We are committed to an inclusive environment where every individual can thrive through a sense of belonging, respect and contribution. Western Digital is committed to offering opportunities to applicants with disabilities and ensuring all candidates can successfully navigate our careers website and our hiring process. Please contact us at jobs.accommodations@wdc.com to advise us of your accommodation request. In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting as well as the job title and requisition number of the position for which you are applying. NOTICE TO CANDIDATES: Western Digital has received reports of scams where a payment is requested on Western Digital’s behalf as a condition for receiving an offer of employment. Please be aware that Western Digital and its subsidiaries will never request payment as a condition for applying for a position or receiving an offer of employment. Should you encounter any such requests, please report it immediately to Western Digitals Ethics Helpline or email compliance@wdc.com

Company Name: McDonald's Malaysia- Gerbang Alaf Restaurants Sdn Bhd
Job Responsibilities: Job responsibilities: DevOps Related: Automating database provisioning, deployments, and configuration management. Integrating database changes into CI/CD pipelines to ensure continuous delivery of new database features or patches. Monitoring database performance and health through Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools, ensuring databases are part of an automated cloud environment. API Related: Develop, support and optimize databases for API based data extraction, ensuring fast and efficient queries that meet API performance needs. Work with Data Engineer to create efficient database queries for data ingestion through RESTful endpoints. Implement APIs for Database-as-a-Service (DBaaS), allowing automated provisioning and querying of databases through API calls. Security related: Implement database-level encryption (for both at rest and in transit) to protect sensitive data. Manage role-based access control (RBAC) and user privileges to ensure that only authorized users can access or modify data. Monitor databases for unauthorized access, SQL injection, and other vulnerabilities. Apply security patches and updates to databases to ensure protection from known exploits. Data Governance /DQ Related: Implement data validation and quality checks within the database to ensure data consistency, completeness, and accuracy. Monitor data quality through profiling and integrity checks, identifying issues like duplicate records, missing values, or incorrect formats. Collaborate with Data Engineer to design databases that support DQ initiatives (e.g., avoiding nulls, enforcing foreign key constraints). Skills: Database Management: Expertise in relational databases such as SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL, and PostgreSQL, as well as NoSQL databases like MongoDB and Cassandra. Proficient in managing cloud-based DBaaS platforms, including from AWS, GCP and Azure. SQL Proficiency: Skilled in writing and optimizing SQL queries, stored procedures, and managing database schemas to support high-performance operations. Backup & Recovery: Implementing robust backup strategies and disaster recovery plans to ensure high availability and data integrity. Performance Tuning: Expertise in optimizing database performance through query tuning, indexing, and effective resource management. Security & Access Control: Managing user roles and permissions, ensuring data security through encryption methods (e.g., TDE, SSL/TLS), and implementing strong access controls with tools like LDAP, OAuth, and Active Directory. API Management: Expertise in optimizing SQL queries for APIs that serve high-volume requests and in managing databases exposed through APIs such as MySQL REST API, Postgres JSON support, and GraphQL. Familiar with API testing and documentation tools like Postman, Swagger, and OpenAPI, and experienced in using database connectors like ODBC, JDBC, and Python DB-API. Data Encryption & Vulnerability Management: Proficient in implementing data encryption strategies (e.g., TDE, SSL/TLS) and conducting vulnerability management to mitigate risks like SQL injection and privilege escalation. Knowledgeable in database auditing using tools like AWS CloudTrail, SQL Server Audit, and Oracle Audit Vault. Data Governance & Data Quality (DQ): Experienced in data profiling using tools for SQL queries to ensure data integrity and consistency. Proficient in using data governance solutions, and in setting up error logging and data cleansing workflows in ETL/ELT pipelines. Expertise in enforcing data integrity with database constraints like foreign keys, uniqueness, and check constraints. Cloud Infrastructure: Strong background in cloud platforms including AWS, Azure, and GCP, with extensive experience in managing cloud databases and leveraging cloud-native services for optimal database management. Generative AI & Automation: Leveraging AI for database optimization, such as automated query performance improvements, synthetic data generation for testing, and AI-driven database documentation and schema design based on historical usage patterns. Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, or a related field. Master's degree preferred. 5+ years of experience in data management and governance Experience with database systems (SQL Server, Oracle, etc.) and data modeling. Strong understanding of data governance, Master Data Management principles and practices. Experience with data management tools and technologies. Excellent project management, problem-solving and analytical skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail. Strong experience with data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing concepts. Solid understanding of database management systems (e.g., SQL, NoSQL) and data integration techniques. Familiarity with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP). Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team. Strong communication skills to effectively interact with technical and non-technical stakeholders.

#LI-GM Job Title: Native Japanese Cloud Engineer (Compute Specialization) Client & Project Overview: We are seeking a talented Cloud Engineer with a specialization in Compute to join our Cloud Engineering team supporting the Google Workspace Support project for our client. This role offers an exciting opportunity to work in a dynamic environment, optimizing cloud computational resources to meet evolving business needs. Key Responsibilities: As a Cloud Engineer (Compute Specialization), you will: Design, deploy, and manage cloud-native solutions to enhance application development and infrastructure scalability. Specialize in managing and optimizing computational resources across cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP) to ensure efficient allocation of processing power. Serve as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) in cloud compute services, providing technical guidance to the team and key stakeholders. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement best practices in cloud operations and resource optimization. Conduct regular assessments, performance tuning, and automation of cloud-native tools and architectures. Provide troubleshooting support and root cause analysis for cloud infrastructure issues. Drive team-level and cross-team decisions to enhance operational efficiency and scalability. Required Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Engineering, preferably in Computer Science or related fields. 8+ years of professional experience in cloud engineering, with a focus on compute services and cloud operations. Advanced proficiency in Cloud Computing, with hands-on experience in cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP. Strong knowledge of cloud compute services, instance scaling, load balancing, and cost optimization techniques. Intermediate proficiency in Cloud Design and Build, including experience with custom application architectures. Advanced expertise in Linux operations, including system administration, performance tuning, and security best practices. Professional certifications such as AWS Certified Solutions Architect, Azure Administrator Associate, or Google Cloud Certified are a plus. Technical Skills: Cloud Platforms: AWS, Azure, GCP (specialization in at least one cloud platform). Linux/Unix Fundamentals: Command line tools (cp, cat, mv, cd, pwd, grep, vi, ls, lsblk, chmod, nano, sudo, ping, ssh, netstat, curl, ifconfig, touch) – Intermediate to Advanced. File systems, directories, access control, symbolic links, partitioning, disk management – Intermediate. Linux Boot Process, GRUB, kernel management – Intermediate. Virtualization concepts and cloud-based VM management – Intermediate. Linux troubleshooting, logging, and monitoring tools – Intermediate. Networking fundamentals (firewalls, routing, VPNs) – Intermediate/Basic. Preferred Experience: Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as Terraform, CloudFormation, or Ansible. Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and automation tools (Jenkins, GitHub Actions, etc.). Strong scripting skills in Python, Bash, or similar languages. Hands-on experience with monitoring tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, or CloudWatch. Additional Responsibilities: Provide architectural recommendations to support business-specific cloud requirements. Document processes, troubleshooting guides, and knowledge-sharing materials. Collaborate with Level 3 support teams to resolve complex technical issues. Continuously evaluate and improve existing cloud strategies to align with industry best practices.

Company Name: Robert Bosch Semiconductor Manufacturing Penang Sdn. Bhd.
Job Responsibilities: Company Description Bosch in Malaysia is a part of the Bosch Group, a leading global supplier of technology and services. The Bosch Group’s strategic objective is to deliver innovations for a connected life. Bosch improves quality of life worldwide with products and services that are innovative and spark enthusiasm. In short, Bosch creates technology that is “Invented for life”. Bosch has been present in Malaysia since 1923, represented by Robert Bosch Sdn Bhd. In Malaysia, Bosch is active in four business sectors: Mobility Solutions, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology. The company has three manufacturing sites and research and development offices in Penang, producing automotive electronics, power tools and steering systems, and now a fourth plant with a final testing centre for sensors and semiconductors. PgP5 Plant is Bosch Group’s newest expansion in Malaysia a semiconductor test site in Batu Kawan Penang. The construction has begun in May 2021 and first series of production commenced in 2023. With the long-term forecasts for growth of semiconductor component quantities, coupled with the front-end production in Bosch’s Dresden facility in Germany, capacity expansion is required for the back-end production, which is the final testing phase of semiconductors and sensors. PgP5 will primarily focus on the final testing of components manufactured at Bosch Automotive Electronics’ fab in Dresden, Germany. The plant will also house R&D and training facilities. The Company Dexcom Corporation (NASDAQ DXCM) is a pioneer and global leader in continuous glucose monitoring (CGM). Dexcom began as a small company with a big dream: To forever change how diabetes is managed. To unlock information and insights that drive better health outcomes. Here we are 25 years later, having pioneered an industry. And we're just getting started. We are broadening our vision beyond diabetes to empower people to take control of health. That means personalized, actionable insights aimed at solving important health challenges. To continue what we've started: Improving human health. We are driven by thousands of ambitious, passionate people worldwide who are willing to fight like warriors to earn the trust of our customers by listening, serving with integrity, thinking big, and being dependable. We've already changed millions of lives and we're ready to change millions more. Our future ambition is to become a leading consumer health technology company while continuing to develop solutions for serious health conditions. We'll get there by constantly reinventing unique biosensing-technology experiences. Though we've come a long way from our small company days, our dreams are bigger than ever. The opportunity to improve health on a global scale stands before us. DayOne Data Center is a leading developer and operator of high-performance Data Centres in Asia Pacific. Dual listed in NASDAQ and Hong Kong, DayOne is the largest carrier-neutral Data Centre service provider in Asia and one of the fastest growing in the world with a presence in Mainland China, Hong Kong, Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia, and Japan. DayOne is on an exciting trajectory, expanding markets internationally and looking for talented individuals who are passionate about growing with us. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to be at the forefront of our expansion efforts. POSITION OVERVIEW Reporting to the Critical Services Manager, the Mechanical Engineering Manager is responsible for overseeing the mechanical infrastructure and systems of our hyperscale data centres. This role ensures the continuous and efficient operation of mechanical systems, upholds high standards of safety and compliance, and supports the Critical Services Manager in strategic initiatives. The successful candidate will lead a team of mechanical engineers and technicians, ensuring the delivery of critical mechanical services 24/7. RESPONSIBILITIES Mechanical System Management: Oversee the design, installation, operation, and maintenance of mechanical systems within the data centres. Ensure all mechanical infrastructure, including HVAC systems, chillers, cooling towers, and fire suppression systems, operates reliably and efficiently. Implement and maintain mechanical safety policies, procedures, and best practices. Team Leadership: Lead, mentor, and develop a team of mechanical engineers and technicians, fostering a culture of excellence and continuous improvement. Coordinate with shift teams to ensure seamless 24/7 coverage and effective handovers between shifts. Conduct regular training sessions and performance evaluations to enhance team capabilities and productivity. Maintenance and Upgrades: Plan and oversee preventative and corrective maintenance activities, ensuring all mechanical equipment and systems are serviced according to manufacturer and company standards. Coordinate with vendors and contractors for mechanical maintenance and upgrade projects, ensuring minimal impact on operations. Safety and Compliance: Ensure all mechanical operations comply with relevant health, safety, and environmental regulations. Maintain up-to-date documentation and records to support compliance audits and certifications. Technical Support: Provide technical expertise and support for mechanical systems, including troubleshooting and resolving complex mechanical issues. Collaborate with other engineering and operations teams to ensure integrated and efficient system performance. Strategic Initiatives: Support the Critical Services Manager in developing and implementing strategic initiatives to enhance mechanical system performance and support business growth. Participate in budget planning and cost management activities to ensure operational efficiency and financial performance. CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field. Minimum of 7-10 years of experience in mechanical engineering, with at least 3-5 years in a managerial role. Strong knowledge of data centre mechanical infrastructure, including HVAC systems, chillers, cooling towers, and fire suppression systems. Proven experience in managing technical teams and 24/7 operations. Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to manage complex mechanical challenges. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders. Certifications such as Professional Engineer (PE) or similar are highly desirable.

Job Details: Job Description: Designs, develops, tests, debugs and deploy software applications in manufacturing ecosystem embedded with AI capabilities such as Predictive Modeling, Deep Learning, Computer Vision, Generative AI, Natural Language Processing, ML-based optimization/simulation and other techniques or integrated with other applications within manufacturing ecosystem. Solution developed with reusable software components, scalable framework and platform. Work closely with cross-functional teams to integrate solution with existing manufacturing systems, ensuring that the solutions are scalable, reliable, deliver tangible results and transform operations. Completes SDL tasks, document development processes and maintain comprehensive records of codebases as well as procedures for installation and maintenance. Interact with end users to define system requirements and/or necessary modifications. Stay abreast of the latest advancements in software development, AI, GenAI, MLOps and evaluate their applicability to the manufacturing processes and ecosystems. Deep expertise in Angular, C#, ASP.Net, Python, Tensorflow, Large Language Model, ELK, Kubernetes, KubeFlow, Scripting, SQL queries, and related software. Experience in AI or software solution architecture design, and development will be an added advantage. Skilled in programming, testing, debugging, documentation and/or deployment of the solution/products. Have strong understanding of manufacturing business segment stakeholders and possess strong written and communication skills. Project/program management experience will have an added advantage. Curiosity and endless desire to learn, along with passion for solving intricate business problems using data science. At Deriv, we are at the cutting edge of financial technology, revolutionizing CFD trading through AI. Our goal is to automate and optimize all aspects of operations, delivering unparalleled performance, innovation, and scalability. We are looking for a highly skilled AI Engineer to lead the development of sophisticated AI-driven systems that empower our business. What You’ll Do: As an AI Engineer at Deriv, you will design and implement advanced AI solutions, integrating them across all operational facets, from trading algorithms to customer experience. Key responsibilities include: Advanced Modeling: Develop and deploy deep learning, reinforcement learning, and graph neural networks for predictive analytics, automated trading strategies, and decision-making systems. NLP Applications: Implement state-of-the-art NLP solutions for sentiment analysis, document processing, and customer interaction enhancements using tools like spaCy, Hugging Face Transformers, and OpenAI APIs. Vector Search and Semantic Retrieval: Build systems utilizing vector databases like Weaviate, Pinecone, and Milvus to enable real-time, context-aware data retrieval. Agentic Systems: Design autonomous and multi-agent systems for dynamic decision-making and complex task management in trading environments. MLOps Integration: Deploy and maintain AI models at scale using tools such as MLflow, Kubeflow, TensorFlow Serving, and Seldon for seamless production workflows. Big Data Engineering: Architect high-performance data pipelines using Apache Spark, Kafka, and Hadoop for real-time and batch processing. Generative AI: Explore and integrate generative technologies, including GPT, DALL-E, and GANs, for innovative applications in user experience and content generation. Transformers and Architectures: Utilize advanced transformer models like BERT, T5, and ViT to solve complex problems in NLP and computer vision. Explainability and Fairness: Incorporate tools like SHAP, LIME, and Fairlearn to ensure AI systems are transparent, interpretable, and unbiased. Optimization: Use advanced hyperparameter tuning tools like Optuna and Ray Tune to maximize model performance. Cloud and Edge AI: Implement scalable AI systems on cloud platforms (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) and optimize for edge computing with TensorFlow Lite and NVIDIA Jetson. What You’ll Need: We are looking for a candidate with exceptional technical expertise and a track record of delivering impactful AI solutions. Technical Skills: Programming Expertise: Proficiency in Python, R, C++, or Java. Deep Learning Frameworks: Expertise in TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn. Data Tools: Experience with Pandas, NumPy, and HDFS for data analysis and storage. Vector Databases: Knowledge of Weaviate, Pinecone, Milvus, or Annoy for similarity-based retrieval systems. Reinforcement Learning: Experience with tools like OpenAI Gym, Ray RLlib, and Stable Baselines. Generative AI Models: Familiarity with GANs, StyleGAN, BigGAN, and transformer-based models for various applications. MLOps and Automation: Proficiency in Docker, Kubernetes, MLflow, Kubeflow, and Seldon for scaling AI operations. Real-Time Processing: Hands-on experience with Flink, Kafka, and event stream processing for dynamic data workflows. Soft Skills: Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills. Ability to collaborate effectively across teams. Proven ability to deliver under tight deadlines. Preferred Qualifications: Advanced degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or related fields. Why Join Us? Work on transformative AI projects with real-world impact. Collaborate with an innovative and forward-thinking team. Competitive compensation and growth opportunities. Access to cutting-edge technologies and learning resources.

Company Description Bosch in Malaysia is a part of the Bosch Group, a leading global supplier of technology and services. The Bosch Group’s strategic objective is to deliver innovations for a connected life. Bosch improves quality of life worldwide with products and services that are innovative and spark enthusiasm. In short, Bosch creates technology that is “Invented for life”. Bosch has been present in Malaysia since 1923, represented by Robert Bosch Sdn Bhd. In Malaysia, Bosch is active in four business sectors: Mobility Solutions, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology. The company has three manufacturing sites and research and development offices in Penang, producing automotive electronics, power tools and steering systems, and now a fourth plant with a final testing center for sensors and semiconductors. PgP5 Plant is Bosch Group’s newest expansion in Malaysia a semiconductor test site in Batu Kawan Penang. The construction has begun in May 2021 and first series of production to commence in 2023. With the long-term forecasts for growth of semiconductor component quantities, coupled with the front-end production in Bosch’s Dresden facility in Germany, capacity expansion is required for the back-end production, which is the final testing phase of semiconductors and sensors. PgP5 will primarily focus on the final testing of components manufactured at Bosch Automotive Electronics’ fab in Dresden, Germany. The plant will also house R&D and training facilities. Job Description Job Overview We are responsible for the planning, installation, maintenance and improvement of the Manufacturing Information Technology, Digitalization and Data Warehouse of our Semiconductor Testing facility in Penang (PgP5). We are also responsible for the coordination and implementation of the IT security, Data Security and the Enterprise IT of the facility. Job Description Being part of the Data Engineering team to establish and sustain an efficient Data Warehouse & Data Integration for Data Analytics for our Final Test facility in Penang. Working closely with our counterparts from both locally and internationally to build and manage Data Pipeline and ensuring high Data quality for Data Analysis and continuous improvement. Perform evaluation on the data by using deep IT knowledge and contribute to improve Data Engineering quality, accuracy, reliability and stability. Responsible for installation, maintenance and improvement of the Data Warehouse, ETL, software components, digitalization and visualization of reports, conducting approval processes and adapting existing processes to functional needs of the new facility. Ensure the data are handled securely according to Bosch Data Security requirements. Provide excellent IT solutions to our internal customers to support Lean Manufacturing and Lean Management. Support the reporting of data and visualization of data to Headquarter and Plant Management. Involved in the Bosch Semiconductor Organization IPN for Data Management and Data Engineering as well as in technology transfers from other semiconductor plants and will provide training and technical guidance on Data Engineering and data related issues. Supports the training and coaching of team members in field of Data Engineering and Data Warehouse. Qualifications Personality: motivated, strong in communication, cooperative in working with colleagues and external parties, assertive personality, ready to travel on occasional business trips. Working Style: able to work independently and be good team player, result- and quality-oriented and reliable. Experience and Knowledge: profound knowledge with relevant practical experience in the field of Data Engineering as well as semiconductor industry experience of at least 3 years; very good knowledge in office applications as well as problem solving techniques and quality methods.; basic technical leadership experience is desired. Ability to design and build data pipelines, data warehouse & data marts. (e.g. ETL tools experience (abinitio, or informatica, datastage, SSIS)). Proficiency in RDBMS (Oracle, SQL Server), complex SQL, PL/SQL, Unix scripting, performance tuning and troubleshooting. Provide resolution to a real time and complicated data pipeline related problem, experience in optimizing SQL queries. Enthusiasm: interdisciplinary thinking and interest in Leading Edge Semiconductor technology. Languages: good proficiency in English language. Education: Bachelor Degree or Master Degree in Information Technology or Computer Engineering or any comparable studies on IT and Data Analytics.

Reporting to the Head of Group Systems and Technology at the Singapore corporate office, the Head of Data and Technology is responsible for leading and executing a comprehensive global data and technology management program. This role encompasses the strategic design, development, implementation, and maintenance of robust database systems and technology solutions to support the company’s plantation, processing, and distribution businesses. The Head of Data and Technology will drive data-driven decision-making across the organization by ensuring seamless integration of data platforms, fostering innovation through digital transformation initiatives, and upholding the highest standards of data governance, security, and compliance. Collaborating with cross-functional teams, this leader will oversee the development of scalable, efficient, and reliable technology infrastructure, enabling the organization to achieve its operational and strategic objectives. Responsibilities Data Strategy and Management Develop and execute a comprehensive data strategy aligned with the organization's strategic goals. Establish and enforce data governance policies to ensure data quality, accuracy, and security. Lead data analytics and business intelligence initiatives to provide actionable insights and support decision-making. Technology Infrastructure Ensure the scalability, reliability, and security of technology systems to support organizational growth. Oversee the implementation and integration of new technologies and systems. Digital Transformation Drive digital transformation projects to enhance operational efficiency and improve customer experience. Identify and implement opportunities for automation and process optimization. Cultivate a culture of innovation and continuous improvement within the technology team. Project Management Oversee the successful execution of technology projects, ensuring they are delivered on time, within scope, and within budget. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align projects with organizational objectives. Promote effective communication and teamwork across departments. Vendor and Stakeholder Management Manage relationships with external technology vendors and service providers. Negotiate contracts and monitor vendor performance to ensure high-quality service delivery. Compliance and Security Ensure compliance with data protection regulations and industry standards. Implement robust cybersecurity measures to safeguard organizational data and systems. Budget and Resource Management Develop and manage the technology budget, ensuring optimal allocation of resources. Identify cost-saving opportunities while maintaining high standards of quality. Operational Responsibilities Translate business requirements into meaningful technical solutions and actionable data strategies. Collaborate closely with finance, sales, logistics, and operations teams to ensure data-driven decision-making. Maintain and oversee the company’s dashboard backend systems and related platform applications. Design, install, configure, and maintain database environments, ensuring optimal performance. Provide technical support for application development, including query optimization, stored procedures, triggers, and indexes. Qualifications Educational Background: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field. Experience: Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience, with proven success in a senior data and technology leadership role. Hands-on experience with database architecture, management, and analytics tools. Experience in implementing digital transformation and managing technology projects. Technical Skills: Proficiency in ASP.Net, MS SQL, MongoDB, C#, Node.js, Python, R, Excel, and data visualization tools. Knowledge of Microsoft Power Platform, Telerik, Siemens MindSphere, and Amazon API interfaces (preferred). Strong understanding of cybersecurity practices and IT compliance standards. Soft Skills: Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities with a focus on factory processes. Excellent leadership, team management, and stakeholder communication skills. Ability to work independently, handle pressure, and meet deadlines. Self-motivated with a continuous improvement mindset. Additional Requirements: • Uphold data privacy laws and ensure the protection of sensitive information. • Ability to undertake additional tasks as assigned in support of business objectives

You will work with other data scientists, data engineers, machine learning engineers, designers and project managers on interdisciplinary projects, using math, stats and machine learning to derive structure and knowledge from raw data across various industry sectors. You are highly collaborative individual who is capable of laying aside your own agenda, listening to and learning from colleagues, challenging thoughtfully and prioritizing impact. You search for ways to improve things and work collaboratively with colleagues. You believe in iterative change, experimenting with new approaches, learning and improving to move forward quickly. Only at McKinsey you will work on real-world, high-impact projects across a variety of industries. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with QB/Labs teams and build complex and innovative ML systems to accelerate our work in AI and help solve business problems at speed and scale. You will experience the best environment to grow as a technologist and a leader. You will develop a sought-after perspective connecting technology and business value by working on real-life problems across a variety of industries and technical challenges to serve our clients on their changing needs. You will be surrounded by inspiring individuals as part of diverse and multidisciplinary teams. You will develop a holistic perspective of AI by partnering with the best design, technical, and business talent in the world as your team members. While we advocate for using the right tech for the right task, we often leverage the following technologies: Python, PySpark, the PyData stack, SQL, Airflow, Databricks, our own open-source data pipelining framework called Kedro, Dask/RAPIDS, container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes, cloud solutions such as AWS, GCP, and Azure, and more. As a Data Scientist, you will: Partner with our clients, from data owners and users to C-level executives, to understand their needs and build impactful analytics solutions Contribute to cross-functional problem-solving sessions with your team and deliver presentations to colleagues and client Translate business problems into analytical problems and develop models aimed at solving our clients and users problems and ensure they are evaluated with the relevant metrics Write highly optimized code to advance our internal Data Science Toolbox Add real-world impact to your academic expertise, as you are encouraged to write papers and present at meetings and conferences should you wish Take part in R&D projects; attend conferences such as NIPS and ICML as well as data science retrospectives where you will have the opportunity to share and learn from your co-workers Work in one of the most advanced data science teams globally Work on the frameworks and libraries that our teams of data scientists and data engineers use to progress from data to impact Guide global companies through data science solutions to transform their businesses and enhance performance across industries including healthcare, automotive, energy and elite sport Bachelor's, master's or PhD level in a discipline such as: computer science, machine learning, applied statistics, mathematics, engineering or artificial intelligence 2+ years of professional experience in applying machine learning and data mining techniques to real problems with copious amounts of data Programming experience (focus on machine learning): SQL and Python’s Data Science stack are a must; good knowledge of at least one big data framework (Pyspark, Hive, Hadoop) is a plus; R, SPSS, SAS (nice to have); Software Engineering is a plus Ability to prototype statistical analysis and modeling algorithms and apply these algorithms for data driven solutions to problems in new domains Experience deploying technology applied to business problems is a plus Knowledge in applying machine learning solution to real problems with complex and/or big amounts of data Knowledge in prompt engineering & GenAI application building (RAG, Agentic systems). Having basic understanding of Engineering standards, QA/Risk Management Willingness to travel

Company Description About SEEK SEEK operates market-leading online employment marketplaces, including Jobstreet and Jobsdb in Asia. SEEK has been helping people live more fulfilling and productive working lives and helping organisations succeed for over 25 years. Founded and headquartered in Melbourne, Australia, SEEK has grown into a multinational technology company with over 3,300 employees and is listed on the Australian Securities Exchange. SEEK’s presence spans Australia, New Zealand, Hong Kong, Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore and Thailand. Additionally, SEEK has minority investments in employment marketplaces in China, South Korea and Bangladesh. SEEK develops and applies innovative data and technology tools to facilitate high-quality matching and improve reliability of marketplace information. In 2021, 2022, 2023 and 2024, SEEK was recognised as one of Australia’s Top Ten Places to Work in Technology in the AFR BOSS Best Places to Work awards. SEEK was also named a 5-Star Employer of Choice by HRD Asia in 2024 and won four accolades at TalentCorp’s Life at Work Awards 2023 in Malaysia. Job Description About the role SEEK is recruiting data analysts at all levels to partner with the Product Team. Seniority will be commensurate with prior experience. In this role, you will support decision-making, drive innovation, and help create exceptional products for our customers. Reporting to an Analytics Manager or Principal Data Analyst, you'll join a team of data analysts collaborating closely with Product Managers across SEEK. Success in this role involves delivering analytical solutions that provide insights into how well our products meet customer needs. This includes creating dashboards, conducting A/B tests, and performing in-depth analyses. We’re seeking a self-starter with strong problem-solving skills, the ability to navigate ambiguity, and comfort working in a fast-paced environment. You must demonstrate good judgment under pressure, a solid background in analytics, and knowledge of key concepts like A/B testing. Attention to detail, organizational excellence, and strong communication skills are crucial. The ideal candidate combines sharp business insight with a proven track record to understand partner needs and translate them into actionable insights. You’ll ensure Product Managers can confidently track product performance, assess the impact of developments, and effectively communicate metrics. Ultimately, your goal is to help our product function optimize outcomes for our customers. Responsibilities: Serve as a trusted analytics partner to collaborators in your specific product area, owning engagement and building positive relationships. Develop structured frameworks for measuring product health (e.g., conversion funnels). Identify and resolve issues, risks, and dependencies effectively. Collaborate with data and product teams to ensure data availability meets business objectives and requirements. Translate sophisticated requirements into actionable documentation. Your Role in Brief As a Data Science (Sustainability) Intern, you will contribute to the integration of sustainability practices by leveraging data science techniques. Your role involves working with property development and construction data, utilizing tools like Power BI and Autodesk to create impactful visualizations. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, ensure effective documentation, and assist in sustainability implementation within the organization. This role is ideal for candidates with a passion for data science and sustainability, looking to make a meaningful impact. What's your job scope like? Assist in handling property development and construction-related sustainability datasets, conducting exploratory data analysis (EDA) to extract insights and uncover patterns. Utilize Python and prompt engineering to automate data extraction from source files, ensuring efficient data processing. Develop interactive dashboards and data visualizations using Power BI and Autodesk tools to effectively monitor and communicate sustainability metrics. Support the automation of data pipelines and predictive modeling to enhance sustainability tracking and reporting processes. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including sustainability, operations, and IT, to optimize data dashboards and support data-driven decision-making. Document code, methodologies, and analytical findings to maintain clarity and ensure continuity of work for future improvements. Conduct research on data-driven sustainability strategies, assisting in the implementation of best practices to support the organization’s sustainability goals. Handling Data Work with property development and construction-related datasets in regards to sustainability. Conduct exploratory data analysis to uncover methods of data extraction, uncover insights and patterns through data visualisation. Implement prompt engineering and python to extract data from source files. Data Visualization Create informative data visualizations using Power BI and Autodesk tools to communicate findings effectively. Create dashboards which are able to effectively monitor project's data. Collaboration Work closely with cross-functional teams to build and communicate usage of the dashboards. Documentation Document code, methodologies, and results to allow continuity of work. Sustainability Implementation Cover sustainability implementation in the organisation assigned. Who are we looking for? Candidates currently pursuing a Bachelor's in Computer Science, or a related field. Have basic understanding of prompt engineering and Power BI. Ability to process and analyse large volume of data and information. Possess an excellent command of the English language (written & oral), strong communication, negotiation, and analytical skills. Note: This job scope is provided as a general guideline. Specific tasks and responsibilities may vary based on the needs of Sunway Property and the ongoing projects during the internship period.

Alpha X is an innovative high-tech manufacturing technology company pioneering the integration of advanced automation, transportation and AI-driven solutions to revolutionize traditional manufacturing processes. We harness the power of artificial intelligence, machine learning, and robotics to optimize production efficiency, enhance product quality, and foster sustainability across diverse high-tech industries. The Role We are seeking an experienced Solution Architect – CIM to lead the design and implementation of advanced manufacturing solutions for our solar production facilities. This role will focus on integrating manufacturing execution systems (MES), automation, and data analytics to optimize production efficiency and quality. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in semiconductor, solar, or electronics manufacturing, with expertise in CIM architecture and smart factory solutions. What you will do: Define and design CIM architectures to support smart manufacturing in solar production lines. Lead MES integration with shop floor automation, SCADA, ERP, and data analytics platforms. Develop IIoT and digital twin strategies for real-time monitoring and predictive analytics. Ensure seamless equipment connectivity (SECS/GEM, OPC UA, MQTT, etc.) with manufacturing systems. Collaborate with cross-functional teams (IT, Operations, Engineering) to ensure smooth implementation of CIM solutions. Drive standardization and modularization of system architecture to enhance scalability and flexibility. Oversee data governance and analytics frameworks to improve manufacturing KPIs. Provide technical guidance on cloud-based or hybrid CIM solutions for better resource optimization. Conduct system evaluations, proof-of-concepts, and feasibility studies for new technologies. Ensure cybersecurity and compliance with industry standards and regulations. What you need to have: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. 8+ years of experience in CIM, MES, or smart manufacturing system design in the solar, semiconductor, or electronics industry. Strong knowledge of SECS/GEM, OPC UA, MQTT, MES, SCADA, and IIoT protocols. Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and edge computing. Familiarity with big data, AI/ML applications, and predictive analytics for manufacturing. Proficiency in database systems (SQL, NoSQL, time-series databases) and data pipeline design. Excellent understanding of automation frameworks, PLCs, and factory integration strategies. Strong problem-solving and communication skills, with the ability to bridge IT and OT teams. Experience with agile project management and DevOps methodologies is a plus. Preferred Certifications: PMP, TOGAF, or relevant architectural framework certification. Certified in cloud technologies (AWS Solutions Architect, Azure Architect, etc.). Six Sigma, Lean Manufacturing, or similar process improvement certifications. You’ll only be the right candidate if you are aligned to our values and culture: Collaborative entrepreneurial spirit Winning through customers High ethical standards, openness and trust Expectations for results Respect and value people If you believe you match our values and have the experience we’re looking for, then apply! We can’t wait to hear from you.

Job Responsibilities: Company Description About SEEK At SEEK, we serve a noble purpose: to help people live more productive and fulfilling working lives and to help organisations succeed. We’re looking for people who thrive in dynamic teams and enjoy tackling regular new challenges in a large-scale, modern, and agile environment. AIPS is focused on solving information problems and is composed of several cross-functional squads that each exist to work on a given set of information problems. Within AIPS there is a diverse range of people and roles, including data scientists, analysts, engineers, data engineers, ontologists, strategy, and product. You will be supported by our senior engineers to hone your skills and provide you with the guidance and opportunities to grow as an engineer. Your contributions will impact hundreds of users across AIPS and influence the AI models that drive SEEK’s products. Maintain clear documentation for code, architecture, and system processes. Java Development: Proficiency in Java (2+ years) Modern Programming Languages: Python / Typescript / JS Automated Testing: Strong understanding of unit testing, particularly with JUnit. Linux and Bash Scripting: Advanced skills in Linux and bash scripting for system management and automation. Data Modelling: Designing entities using Json Schema as interfaces or contracts between systems. Hands-on experience using Spring Boot and Spring Framework.
